text: Has anyone else had problem that you need to create seperate template for each blog because blog listing pages doesn't support that cms editor that landing pages, emails and blog posts have? Because it feels like i need to create new template other blog has a bit different settings in some modules.

yes, the blog listing is not an actual “page” it is more like a feed. So all of the modules you place on the blog listing are not editable in the pages editor. they have to be edited on the template level.
yeah, that's what i thought, but it's getting a bit hard to maintain all these templates as we have 30-40 which are almost identical, but have different modules and settings

I have a client that have been set up by another agency in French with 30 blogs...
Today they just have 4... It’s impossible to maintain 30-40 blogs.. Good luck
just counted we have 22 blogs and each have seperate listing and post template, so we have 44 templates to maintain + custom modules.
In future i would be nice to have "flexible" blog listing templates to we don't need to create templates for each listing page
you can add extra modules to a blog along with some if statements whether to show those modules on the page or not. would be better than managing 30 blog templates

Am I doing something wrong or is this a HubSpot error: When using a form inside a custom module all the form options are not showing up on the page editor … the only thing showing us is a dropdown to choose a form … but no way to add/change title or any other options that come when a form module is used on it’s own
using the beta for creating the custom module
